verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:29
verses.text: XLIII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:30
verses.text: After this he comes to the water, and blesses and glorifies the Lord God Almighty, the Father of the only begotten God; and the priest returns thanks that He has sent His Son to become man on our account, that He might save us; that He has permitted that He should in all things become obedient to the laws of that incarnation, to preach the kingdom of heaven, the remission of sins, and the resurrection of the dead.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:31
verses.text: Moreover, he adores the only begotten God Himself, after His Father, and for Him, giving Him thanks that He undertook to die for all men by the cross, the type of which He has appointed to be the baptism of regeneration.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:32
verses.text: He glorifies Him also, for that God who is the Lord of the whole world, in the name of Christ and by His Holy Spirit, has not cast off mankind but has suited His providence to the difference of seasons: at first giving to Adam himself paradise for an habitation of pleasure, and afterwards giving a command on account of providence, and casting out the offender justly, but through His goodness not utterly casting him off, but instructing his posterity in succeeding ages after various manners; on whose account, in the conclusion of the world, He has sent His Son to become man for man's sake, and to undergo all human passions without sin.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:33
verses.text: Him, therefore, let the priest even now call upon in baptism, and let him say: Look down from heaven, and sanctify this water, and give it grace and power, that so he that is to be baptized, according to the command of Thy Christ, may be crucified with Him, and may die with Him, and may be buried with Him, and may rise with Him to the adoption which is in Him, that he may be dead to sin and live to righteousness.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:34
verses.text: And after this, when he has baptized him in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, he shall anoint him with ointment, and shall add as follows:—  A Thanksgiving Concerning the Mystical Ointment.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:35
verses.text: XLIV.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:36
verses.text: O Lord God, who art without generation, and without a superior, the Lord of the whole world, who hast scattered the sweet odour of the knowledge of the Gospel among all nations, do Thou grant at this time that this ointment may be efficacious upon him that is baptized, that so the sweet odour of Thy Christ may continue upon him firm and fixed; and that now he has died with Him, he may arise and live with Him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:37
verses.text: Let him say these and the like things, for this is the efficacy of the laying on of hands on every one; for unless there be such a recital made by a pious priest over every one of these, the candidate for baptism does only descend into the water as do the Jews, and he only puts off the filth of the body, not the filth of the soul.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:38
verses.text: After this let him stand up, and pray that prayer which the Lord taught us.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:39
verses.text: But, of necessity, he who is risen again ought to stand up and pray, because he that is raised up stands upright.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:40
verses.text: Let him, therefore, who has been dead with Christ, and is raised up with Him, stand up.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:41
verses.text: But let him pray towards the east.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:42
verses.text: For this also is written in the second book of the Chronicles, that after the temple of the Lord was finished by King Solomon, in the very feast of dedication the priests and the Levites and the singers stood up towards the east, praising and thanking God with cymbals and psalteries, and saying, "Praise the Lord, for He is good; for His mercy endureth for ever".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:43
verses.text: A Prayer for the New Fruits.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:44
verses.text: XLV.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:45
verses.text: But let him pray thus after the foregoing prayer, and say: O God Almighty, the Father of Thy Christ, Thy only begotten Son, give me a body undefiled, a heart pure, a mind watchful, an unerring knowledge, the influence of the Holy Ghost for the obtaining and assured enjoying of the truth, through Thy Christ, by whom glory be to Thee, in the Holy Spirit, for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 3:46
verses.text: We have thought it reasonable to make these constitutions concerning the catechumens.

chapters.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:1
verses.text: Sec.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:2
verses.text: IV.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:3
verses.text: —Enumeration Ordained by Apostles.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:4
verses.text: Who Were They that the Holy Apostles Sent and Ordained?  XLVI.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:5
verses.text: Now concerning those bishops which have been ordained in our lifetime, we let you know that they are these:—James the bishop of Jerusalem, the brother of our Lord; upon whose death the second was Simeon the son of Cleopas; after whom the third was Judas the son of James.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:6
verses.text: Of Caesarea of Palestine, the first was Zacchaeus, who was once a publican; after whom was Cornelius, and the third Theophilus.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:7
verses.text: Of Antioch, Euodius, ordained by me Peter; and Ignatius by Paul.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:8
verses.text: Of Alexandria, Annianus was the first, ordained by Mark the evangelist; the second Avilius by Luke, who was also an evangelist.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:9
verses.text: Of the church of Rome, Linus the son of Claudia was the first, ordained by Paul; and Clemens, after Linus' death, the second, ordained by me Peter.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:10
verses.text: Of Ephesus, Timotheus, ordained by Paul; and John, by me John.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:11
verses.text: Of Smyrna, Aristo the first; after whom Strataeas the son of Lois; and the third Aristo.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:12
verses.text: Of Pergamus, Gaius.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:13
verses.text: Of Philadelphia, Demetrius, by me.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:14
verses.text: Of Cenchrea, Lucius, by Paul.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:15
verses.text: Of Crete, Titus.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:16
verses.text: Of Athens, Dionysius.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:17
verses.text: Of Tripoli in Phoenicia, Marathones.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:18
verses.text: Of Laodicea in Phrygia, Archippus.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:19
verses.text: Of Colossae, Philemon.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:20
verses.text: Of Borea in Macedonia, Onesimus, once the servant of Philemon.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:21
verses.text: Of the churches of Galatia, Crescens.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:22
verses.text: Of the parishes of Asia, Aquila and Nicetas.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:23

verses.text: These are the bishops who are entrusted by us with the parishes in the Lord; whose doctrine keep ye always in mind, and observe our words.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:25
verses.text: And may the Lord be with you now, and to endless ages, as Himself said to us when He was about to be taken up to His own God and Father.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 4:26
verses.text: For says He, "Lo, I am with you all the days, until the end of the world, Amen".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 5:8
verses.text: For Thy great glory, O Lord and heavenly King, O God the Father Almighty, O Lord God, the Father of Christ the immaculate Lamb, who taketh away the sin of the world, receive our prayer, Thou that sittest upon the cherubim.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book VII 5:14
verses.text: Praise becomes Thee, hymns become Thee, glory becomes Thee, the God and Father, through the Son, in the most holy Spirit, for ever and ever, Amen.
